intro: Casearia ekmanii, commonly known as the Kauai casearia, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
